summary: This bill, the Nurse Staffing Standards for Hospital Patient Safety and Quality Care Act of 2025, aims to improve patient safety and healthcare quality by establishing minimum direct care registered nurse-to-patient staffing ratios in hospitals. It mandates hospitals to implement staffing plans, with specific ratios based on unit type, and includes provisions for enforcement, whistleblower protection, and adjustments in reimbursement for Medicare and other federal programs. The bill also includes a nurse workforce initiative with scholarship and retention grants, and requires the Secretary of Health and Human Services to make recommendations to Congress regarding nurse availability.
